                                                                     Hex-Dump Conversion
                           .Background Q&A on Minimum Wage

Q: Won't it be a great burden for the states if you require them to pay welfare recipients
the minimum wage?

       A. There has already been an enormous amount of welfare reform innovation taking
       place in the states, whether through demonstration waivers or workfare programs, and
       many states have already addressed this issue as part of those programs. In most
       instances where it has come up, states have made the decision to pay the minimum wage.
       We have no reason to believe they would change course on this issue ..

       It is difficult to generalize about how states would be affected, because we don't know
       how individual states will choose to spend their new TANF block grant money, or how
       much the already shrinking case load in individual states will reduce the number of people
       they must put to work.

       However, paying the minimum wage should not be a problem in most states. This is
       particularly true in the next year or two, as the requirements of the law are still being
       phased in.
